Descrição:
About EllaLink

EllaLink owns and operates the world’s fastest route between Europe and Latin America and provides a diverse network infrastructure and capacity services to tier 1 operators & content providers in European and Latin America tier-one cities.

At EllaLink we believe in bringing the world closer through better network latency.

Broad Role Description

  • The role is responsible for keeping continuous monitoring of the network, analysing all events in a short and effective time, responding to all network issues, incident reporting, debug, and troubleshoot.
  • The role is also responsible for keeping continuous monitoring of all auxiliary systems that support all the operations, putting in place all necessary actions and procedures to recover from any events on an efficient and effective time, avoiding impact on the network and services.
  • The NOC engineer works on a round-the-clock team model providing 24x7 coverage to ensuring maximum uptime of production network by monitoring and ensuring timely resolution of incidents.
  • The NOC is also responsible by Change Management Control, assuring that all actions and changes to the network and infrastructure are performed against the plan and executed to meet the agreed maintenance windows, monitoring network impacts assuring that it doesn’t exceed the approved plans.
  • This role will also be responsible to ensure that service provision, test, and deliver of new customer services are completed on time, “right first time,” and within the defined timelines. You may also be required to configure system hardware and manage system backups.
  • The role provides the first line of contact and support for both internal and external customers in the way of informing, resolving, or escalate incidents. Provide Route Cause analysis and reporting.
  • This role will be a central point of contact for both internal and external customers.

Key Role Deliverables

  • During the next months but not limited to, the NOC Engineer will be supporting the testing and development of new procedures, the preparation, and implementation of all infrastructure to support EllaLink Network Operations Center.
  • Monitor 24x7 all active assets on the network, facilities, and support systems.
  • Operate and maintain 24x7 Network Operations Center (NOC) ensuring reliability and quality of services.
  • Manage and solve network and facility incidents in a time-efficient manner, monitor and control MTTR metrics.
  • Provision, test and deliver services to customers (internal and external) according to the agreed timelines, monitor, and control MTTI metrics.
  • Be the first point of Customers, answering, informing, and supporting them on a regular basis – Customer Care Center.
  • Interact and contact with all EllaLink corporate areas, following established procedures.
  • Interact and contact with 3rd party suppliers and contractors whenever it revels necessary and following procedures in place, ensuring SLA compliance.
  • Handle and solve tickets according to operational procedures in place.
  • Escalate issues whenever it is necessary, either to internal level 2 of support or to third party entities.
  • Own end-to-end incident management process for network and facility incidents, controlling all open cases and associated SLAs.
  • Escalate and inform all major network incidents to NOC Manager and management team, keeping organization informed and aware of relevant known issues and the steps being taken.
  • Report directly to NOC Manager on incidents performance, escalation cases, and whenever Major impact (or may impact) services.
  • Provide out of hours support to the business
  • Work focus on keep customers, team and EllaLink defined objectives and KPIs
  • Identify recurring issues and work with internal engineering teams or 3rd party suppliers on mitigating procedures and solution
  • Report directly to NOC Manager on any incidents that impact or may impact the services
  • Own and maintain an operations relationship with 3rd party suppliers and contractors, ensuring SLA compliance, notifying internal organization whenever SLAs are not met
  • Be a teammate willing to cover any needs of the team and the enterprise
  • Participate and propose an improvement to the processes and procedures used by the team using innovative and nonstandard processes and tooling
  • Get involved with the team and work together with other departments in Ellalink to achieve common business goals
  • Participate and propose an improvement to documentation, policies, and standards related to the departments work processes which are up to date and accurately reflects the day to day running of the team
  • Develop and publish operations and network performance reports

Ideal Experience Profile

  • Bachelor’s degree in Communication Engineering, computer science, information systems, or a related field
  • 3+ years of expert-level hands-on skills with traditional networking technologies
  • 3+ years of experience in a NOC or IT Service Desk role is desirable
  • Deep IT/System knowledge
  • A knowledge of telecom networks and services with international experience highly desired, which includes:
  • o SDH
  • o DWDM
  • o IP, Ethernet, MPLS
  • o Fibre Characterization and handling (OTDR, COTDR OSA, Test sets)
  • Knowledge of subsea cable Operation and maintenance
  • o PFE
  • o SLTE
  • o Submarine Fault Location (LME, COTDR, OSA)
  • Knowledge or experience in monitoring infrastructure
  • o Electricity backup systems: Generators, UPS, DC, and Battery Plants.
  • o Electricity
  • o Air Conditioning Systems
  • o Fire & Security Systems
  • o Building Management tools
  • o DCIM
  • o VISIO or AutoCAD
  • Knowledge or experience in equipment and circuit inventory and monitoring tools
  • Relevant technical certifications are highly appreciated

 

Please send your CV to: jobs@ella.link

 

Good Luck !!

A Randstad é a empresa número 1 no setor de recursos humanos a nível mundial e líder em Portugal. Com presença em todo o país, conta com oportunidades de emprego para diferentes setores de atividade, como indústria, serviços de apoio ao cliente e vendas, tecnologias da informação, finanças e banca, hotelaria, turismo e restauração, recursos humanos, entre outras.
Aqui vais encontrar a tua próxima oportunidade profissional! #humanforward
 

A Randstad Digital é especializada no recrutamento de quadros médios e superiores.

 

O nosso cliente é um líder global em parcerias com empresas para transformar e gerir os seus negócios, aproveitando o poder da tecnologia e está à procura de Network Engineer para um projeto de grande envergadura com várias vagas em aberto na área das redes.

 


descrição da função/job description

Integrar e participar ativamente em projetos de consultoria em redes e infraestruturas de telecomunicações, com foco em redes empresariais (IT) e/ou industriais (OT);
Planear, coordenar e/ou executar com autonomia as atividades subjacentes à concretização dos diversos outputs no âmbito de um projeto;
Gerir a relação com clientes e stakeholders, de acordo com a sua esfera de atuação.

 


requisitos/requirements

Experiência de trabalho no desenho e/ou gestão e/ou implementação de redes empresariais (IT) ou  industriais (OT) ou cloud;
Conhecimentos de infraestruturas de telecomunicações e de processos de implementação de redes.
- Desenho e implementação de redes (WAN, LAN, DC e cloud); 
- Conhecimentos de Cloud migration (arquitetura VPCs/ Vnet, conetividade intra e inter cloud, etc.);
- Desenho e implementação de soluções e controlos para segurança de redes empresariais (firewalls, segmentação/ microsegmentação, secure web gateways, VPN's, etc.);
 

 

Idealmente com certificações de redes e/ou Cloud (exemplo: Cisco CCNA Routing & Switching; Azure AZ-900, AZ-304, AZ-700);
Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
Competências de comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, trabalho em equipa e colaboração;
Resolução de problemas, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico;
Organização, planeamento e orientação para a qualidade dos projetos;
Disponibilidade para projetos internacionais.

 


oferta/offer

A oportunidade de trabalhar em projectos interessantes e desafiantes para clientes nacionais e internacionais;
A oportunidade de trabalhar em equipas fantásticas e dinâmicas;
Seguro de saúde e de vida;
Possibilidade de investir em certificações e formação;
Um contrato permanente com um pacote de remuneração e benefícios atractivos.

 


para se candidatar/to apply
https://www.randstad.pt/empregos/title_location_DTS-2024-155309

Who are we:
Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems. 
We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.
With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.
Neotalent, the responsive people.

Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt. 

Role Overview:

We are looking for an Information Security & Risk Consultant to join one of our biggest clients – an International Group - in Porto area.

What you will do:
You’ll have the chance to work with a talented and international team and be involved in IT Risk and Operational Control topics. The mission of the Information Security & Risk Consultant is to ensure, for the IT Risk Central activity, the audit management (control, oversight, reporting and follow-up) including the measure and the closure of all recommendations issued by the Risk & Control functions from the Group.

Are you ready for a leap in your career?

What you are like

  • At least 2 years of experience in similar roles;
  • Previous experience in IT Risk, IT Controls and audit processes and methodology;
  • Knowledge of core Information Security and Risk standards related to IT Risk, Cybersecurity, IT Governance, Risk & Compliance (equivalent to ISO 27000/ 3100 -series standards or other similar standards/frameworks);             
  • Experience working with IT controls frameworks including risk assessment;
  • Knowledge of IT tools as Word, PowerPoint, Excel , Business Intelligence tools, etc.
  • Fluent in English.

Why join us

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Possibility of working remotely
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  •  … and much more!

To apply:

Please send your CV to talentos@neotalent.pt with MVT_IS in the email subject.

Electrical Engineer – Shape the Future of Industrial Automation with Allaxa Smart

Allaxa Smart is an innovative IT services provider, empowering clients with tailored solutions across IT and adjacent business domains. From concept through implementation and ongoing support, we’re there every step of the way. Now, we’re building a team of high-caliber professionals who will drive our vision forward.
We’re seeking an ambitious and skilled

Electrical Engineer

with a passion for innovation, eager to make a difference in a global setting.

Your Role

Join us in collaborating with a leading Swiss client, known for delivering custom industrial automation solutions and developing cutting-edge control and switch cabinet systems. You’ll bring your expertise to the table, adding value through your experience in project management and switchgear and control system construction. Expect a dynamic, varied role within a motivated international team, offering exceptional growth potential.

What You Bring to the Team

  • Self-Motivated Professional – Ready to take on new challenges with an independent, proactive approach.
  • Adaptable Problem-Solver – Highly motivated, solution-oriented, and committed to delivering results.
  • Lifelong Learner – Eager to acquire new skills and lead projects autonomously.
  • Collaborative Team Player – Able to thrive in a team-oriented, cooperative work environment.

 

Ideal Background

  • Degree in Electrical Engineering or similar field
  • Hands-On Experience in setting up switching and control systems
  • Proven Project Expertise in relevant areas
  • Outstanding Communication Skills – Interpersonal, organizational, and communication abilities are a must.
  • Team-Oriented Attitude
  • Language Skills – Fluency in English required; German is a plus.
     

What We Offer

  • Global Opportunities – Work on international projects within a supportive and forward-thinking environment.
  • Growth & Development – Ongoing training and professional growth.
  • Modern Workspace – Flexible options in Lisbon, Switzerland, or remote, with full onboarding support.
     

Location: Lisbon

Ready to make your mark? Excited for the next step in your career?

Then we want to meet you! Please send your application in English along with a photo to jobs@allaxa-smart.com. Use “Electrical Engineer” as your subject line.

Qlik Sense Tech Lead

There's no secret to being number-one; it takes willingness to improve and determination to pursue it. At GRiT®, it’s all about the journey to get there. We believe talent and intelligence are important, yet passion and perseverance are the key to achieving any goal.

We are Tech Passionate People with a Purpose, delivering solutions while building strong long-term relations.

Recognizing each person’s unique contribution to our collective success, we embrace inclusion and diversity, committed to creating a respectful and socially responsible environment.

People. Technology. Innovation. All-around it.

Are you GRiTTY enough to be part of our journey? Take the first step by applying now and let’s create our future together.

 

Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced Qlik Sense Tech Lead to join our team in Lisbon and play a key role in a strategic, long-term project with a prestigious client in the automotive industry. This role will involve both application development and ongoing maintenance, with a focus on delivering high-quality solutions that meet client specifications.

Must-Have:

  • 5+ years of experience working with Qlik Sense in a professional setting
  • Proven expertise in data visualization, dashboard creation, and report generation using Qlik Sense
  • Experience in team leadership and/or project management is highly valued
  • Ability to work in a hybrid setup, with part-time on-site requirements in Lisbon
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Proficiency in English and Portuguese is essential, both written and spoken

Would be great if you have:

  • Experience working on projects in the automotive industry
  • Knowledge of ETL processes, data modeling, and business intelligence methodologies
  • Familiarity with agile methodologies and collaborative tools

What’s in it for you:

  • Continuous Training and Certifications 
  • GRiT Prizes: GRiT Baby Gift, GRiT Birthday Prize, GRiT Recommendation Prize 
  • Exclusive Partnerships/Discounts: (Gym, Health, Well-being, Lifestyle, Financial, etc…) 
  • Unique Events 
  • Welcoming Office (Fruit, Coffee, Pool Table, etc.) 
  • Competitive Compensation 
  • Pay for Performance 

 

#PassionInTech - Fuel your passion, join our tech tribe!

 

Apply here: https://grit-solutions.key.work/jobs/opportunity/353
